issue.title: Task-3 Steps are uneven and to small

content.raw:
My biggest concern is that the ankle joint is aligned with the edge of the step. It appears that if the foot is not far enough forward then there will a torque generated at the ankle. The tolerance for this torque looks like about 25 millimeters. This means that foot placement is going to be very important in order to avoid this ankle torque and that the margin of error is going to be very small.

I would guess that it may be safer to walk up the stairs backwards. I am not working on task-3 yet but will test that option to see if it is going to work better.
